name: St. Ignatius of Loyola

locations.description: Founded the Society of Jesus in Rome
Studied at the University of Paris

summary: Ignatius of Loyola was a Spanish Basque priest and theologian who founded the Society of Jesus (Jesuits) in 1540. After being wounded in battle, he experienced a profound conversion and dedicated his life to God. He wrote the Spiritual Exercises, one of the most influential works of Christian spirituality. The Jesuits became a major force in the Counter-Reformation, emphasizing education, missionary work, and obedience to the papacy.
keyQuotes: Go forth and set the world on fire.
Pray as if everything depended on God; work as if everything depended on you.
